sprite.name: Autoscrolling Controller
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x1A5 Description: A Controller that causes the screen to automatically scroll. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must be paired with a path.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When triggered, the controller will start moving.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The event to trigger upon reaching the final node. Only works with ending behaviors 0 and 3.

value.title: Midway Starting Node
value.comment: Value+1. The path node that movement should start from if the level is entered from a checkpoint.

list.title: Starting Behavior
list.comment: Determines how the controller will act when starting.

list.title: Ending Behavior
list.comment: Determines how the controller will act when ending.

value.title: Repeat Start Node
value.comment: For ending behavior 1; the node to move backwards to before repeating.

checkbox.title: Linear Movement
checkbox.comment: If checked, the autoscroller will move linearly along the path.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: The path the autoscroller will follow.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The entrance ID to map to a starting node.

value.title: Entrance Starting Node
value.comment: Once the entrance ID has been exited, the controller will scroll to this path node.

sprite.name: Pipe Bubbles
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x056 Description: Bubbles that come out of a pipe and push the player away. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Turns off while the specified Event ID is activated.

checkbox.title: Just Bubbles
checkbox.comment: When checked only the bubbles will be shown. (Nothing will be visible if placed outside water.)

list.title: Push Distance
list.comment: Controls the distance of the water flow. 8 is unused and creates large bubbles that run across the screen.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: Which way the pipe its placed on is facing.

sprite.name: Downwards Water Pull
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x058 Description: Water flow that pulls the player downwards. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must be underwater.

list.title: Width
list.comment: When 1 or above the size is always 5 tiles.

sprite.name: Cheep Chomp
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x13D Description: A large fish that will try to eat the player. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When the Event ID is triggered, the Cheep Chomp will move away towards a direction.

list.title: Triggering Behavior
list.comment: A Value of 0 Makes the Cheep Chomp Swim straight in the direction it is currently facing. A Value of 1 makes it turn to swim off the right of the screen.

sprite.name: Burner - Right
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x05C Description: A flamethrower that faces right. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: None

checkbox.title: Pauses
checkbox.comment: When checked, the burner does not stay on constantly.

value.title: Pause Time
value.comment: Increases how long the burner pauses for. (Requires Nybble 4 to have a value of 1))

checkbox.title: Longer Flame
checkbox.comment: Makes the fire longer.

checkbox.title: Has No Collision
checkbox.comment: When checked, the burner will have no collision. [Unused]

checkbox.title: Has No Collision
checkbox.comment: When checked, the burner will have no collision. [Unused]

sprite.name: Swooper
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x100 Description: An enemy that flies towards the player when they get close. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: None

checkbox.title: Swoop Short Distance
checkbox.comment: When checked, when the swooper drops down to begin moving in the direction of the player, the swooper will not swoop doward as low.

list.title: Behavior
list.comment: Used in coin rush level 14-1

sprite.name: Whomp
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0C5 Description: An enemy that will try to crush the player. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Resources Loader - Whomp

value.title: Spawned Object Target Event ID
value.comment: This target event ID will be passed to the spawned object; useful for red rings, star coins, etc.

list.title: Red Coin Ring Reward
list.comment: 2 always rewards a gold flower card, no matter what.

list.title: Star/Moon Coin Number
list.comment: Determines what star coin to spawn.

list.title: Roulette Block Contents
list.comment: Determines the contents of the Roulette Block.

list.title: Object to Spawn
list.comment: If Movement = Walks, this object appears when the Whomp is KO'd. If Movement = Still, it is appeared when the Whomp is down. Star Coin is Unused.

value.title: Patrol Range
value.comment: Determines how far the whomp will walk. Value 0 produces a patrol range of one block on each side, but the Whomp will ignore the range after being angered once. Non-default values behave as expected.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Determines the direction the whomp will face when spawned.

checkbox.title: Stays Still
checkbox.comment: Controls whether or not the Whomp walks.

checkbox.title: Big
checkbox.comment: Also increases amount of coins, if Object is is set to Coins.

sprite.name: Switchable Conveyor Belt - Lemmy Koopa Battle
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x084 Description: A Conveyor Belt that changes direction when triggered by an event. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Can only be used in a Lemmy battle.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: What Event ID triggers the conveyor belt.

value.title: Collider Width
value.comment: Determines how wide the collision for the platform is. (Set this to 12 to have the collider correctly match the model)

sprite.name: Water Flow
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x057 Description: A Current that will push or pull the player through water. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have a location ID set.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This Event ID triggers the flow turning off.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: What location the water flow should be in.

list.title: Strength
list.comment: Controls the strength of the flow.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The direction of the water flow.

sprite.name: Lava
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x040 Description: Lava that kills the player once in contact. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Triggering Event ID [Deprecated]
value.comment: Same as Triggering Event ID (2-3), but with less features.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Triggers liquid movement as specified by the speed/distance settings. If combined with "Rising Lava", allows enabling/disabling the rising/lowering behavior.

list.title: Speed/Direction
list.comment: The speed and direction of liquid movement. If no Event ID is set, moves endlessly upward.

value.title: Lowering Delay
value.comment: Time it takes before the liquid lowers.

value.title: Rising Delay
value.comment: Time it takes before the liquid rises.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: The base movement distance, in tiles.

checkbox.title: Rising/Lowering Lava
checkbox.comment: Makes the lava rise/lower when checked.

checkbox.title: Topless
checkbox.comment: Removes the top.

sprite.name: Poison
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x041 Description: Poison water that kills the player on contact. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Triggering Event ID [Deprecated]
value.comment: Same as Triggering Event ID (2-3), but with less features.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Triggers liquid movement as specified by the speed/distance settings. If combined with "Rising Poison", allows enabling/disabling the rising/lowering behavior.

list.title: Speed/Direction
list.comment: The speed and direction of liquid movement.

value.title: Lowering Delay
value.comment: Time it takes before the liquid lowers.

value.title: Rising Delay
value.comment: Time it takes before the liquid rises.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: The base movement distance, in tiles.

checkbox.title: Rising/Lowering Poison
checkbox.comment: Makes the poison rise/lower when checked.

checkbox.title: Topless
checkbox.comment: Removes the top.

sprite.name: Cloud FG Effect
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x042 Description: A horizontal line of clouds. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

sprite.name: Water
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x03F Description: Water that the player can swim in. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Triggering Event ID [Deprecated]
value.comment: Same as Triggering Event ID (2-3), but with less features.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Triggers liquid movement as specified by the speed/distance settings. If combined with "Rising Water", allows enabling/disabling the rising/lowering behavior.

list.title: Speed/Direction
list.comment: The speed and direction of liquid movement.

value.title: Lowering Delay
value.comment: Time it takes before the liquid lowers.

value.title: Rising Delay
value.comment: Time it takes before the liquid rises.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: The base movement distance, in tiles.

checkbox.title: Rising/Lowering Water
checkbox.comment: Makes the water rise/lower when checked.

checkbox.title: Underwater Lighting
checkbox.comment: Uses alternate texture for underwater lighting.

checkbox.title: Appear Behind Layer 1
checkbox.comment: Makes the water appear behind Mario (and likely other objects). Does not affect tiles.

list.title: Underwater Transparency Level
list.comment: Adjusts the transparency level of the water when "Underwater Lighting" is checked.

sprite.name: Amp
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x131 Description: An electric orb that will hurt the player on contact. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

checkbox.title: Behind Layer 1
checkbox.comment: Appear behind layer 1. Unchecked: 1500.0, Checked: -2500.0

sprite.name: Amp Circle
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x133 Description: A rotating circle of Amps. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When triggered the coins will spawn.

checkbox.title: Coins Above Amps
checkbox.comment: If checked, the coins will appear above the amps.

value.title: Circle Radius
value.comment: Value +1.5.

value.title: Number of Amps
value.comment: The number of Amps in the circle. Value +1.

list.title: Coin Type
list.comment: Determines the type of coin the circle will use.

checkbox.title: Visible Rail
checkbox.comment: If checked, a rail will be shown.

list.title: Rotation Speed
list.comment: The speed of the Amps as they rotate. Any values equal to or above 3 return 0.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: The direction the Amps spin in.

list.title: Gap Replacement
list.comment: Coins in circle jump up 1 tile after level fade-in.

bitfield.title: Amp Gap Position
bitfield.comment: The gap where the player can jump through.

sprite.name: Tile Creater/Destroyer (Tile God Event)
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x1B2 Description: A sprite that can create and destroy tiles in a level. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have a triggering ID set.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: What Event ID triggers the action.

checkbox.title: Tiles Are Permanent
checkbox.comment: Tiles created by the Tilegod will not despawn.

checkbox.title: Disable when Reloaded
checkbox.comment: If the sprite gets reloaded (when in the camera's range) when it has already been activated at least once, it will no longer be reactivatable.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment: Determines the pattern the spawned tiles will be in.

list.title: Tile Index
list.comment: Determines the index into the Tileset to use. Values of 7 and above are invalid and will give unexpected results.

list.title: Action
list.comment: The action the tile god should do.

checkbox.title: Despawn Self
checkbox.comment: If enabled the Tilegod will despawn itself after 1 frame. Can be used to trigger changes that only happen while the Tilegod is not in view of the player. Requires "Tiles Are Permanent" to be enabled for creation to function correctly.

checkbox.title: Smoke Effect
checkbox.comment: Adds a smoke poof effect when a tile is created or destroyed.

value.title: Width Overflow
value.comment: 0 is same as 1. Expands to the left.

value.title: Height Overflow
value.comment: 0 is same as 1. Expands upwards.

value.title: Width
value.comment: 0 is same as 1. Expands to the right.

value.title: Height
value.comment: 0 is same as 1. Expands downwards.

sprite.name: Desert Crater
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0B9 Description: A Crater that triggers an event when destroyed. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Target event must be set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Switches on when exploded by a Bob-omb.

sprite.name: Gold Block
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0B5 Description: A Golden brick block that can be worn by the player. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

sprite.name: Note Block
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0B0 Description: A block that the player can bounce on. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

value.title: Width (Buggy)
value.comment: Sets the width = n+1 tiles. Collision is not changed. [Unused]

value.title: Unknown Value 9
value.comment: Max value is 0x0F. Seems to be be used in odd/even patterns.

checkbox.title: Auto Triggered - Uses Tileset Tile
checkbox.comment: Uses slot 1 tileset tile with id 98 [Unused]

list.title: Item
list.comment: The item is only spawned if the block is hit from below.

sprite.name: Special Exit Controller (Warp Entrance)
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x1B0 Description: A sprite that will warp the player to an entrance on contact. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have an entrance ID set.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: Broken; Mario gets stuck if after touching warp area if this is set to >0, even if flag is/gets activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 2
value.comment: Same as Triggering Event ID 1

list.title: Trigger Point
list.comment: Determines the part of the warp that will trigger the exit.

list.title: Mario Movement
list.comment: 4=Mario jumps while saying "wahee" and the level is completed with the normal exit. With this, the Entrance ID doesn't matter.

value.title: Entrance ID Overflow
value.comment: Adds 16*n to the Entrance ID. Used to set Entrance IDs above 15.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The actor warps Mario to the destination of this entrance.

sprite.name: Respawnable Hidden Block
sprite.notes: This sprite checks for a tile at the given relative position. If no tile is found at the given position, the sprite will act as a hidden block, otherwise it will act as air.

list.title: Horizontal Direction To Tile
list.comment: Determines the horizontal direction to check for a tile.

value.title: Horizontal Distance To Tile
value.comment: Determines the horizontal offset to the tile.

list.title: Vertical Direction To Tile
list.comment: Determines the vertical direction to check for a tile.

value.title: Vertical Distance To Tile
value.comment: Determines the vertical offset to the tile.

sprite.name: Flying ? Block
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0AF Description: A ? block with wings. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

checkbox.title: Move Left
checkbox.comment: Ignores the behavior nybble, and if checked, will move left instead of right.

list.title: Color
list.comment: The color of the Flying ? Block. Hit animations stay yellow, however.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: 10="Wings fall off" effect plays every time block is hit.

sprite.name: Fly Away ? Block (contains 1-Up)
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0B4 Description: A ? Block that flies away once hit once. It will contain a 1-UP. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

list.title: Color
list.comment: You probably have to use the proper stage tileset to have these be correct before hit.

checkbox.title: Moves Faster
checkbox.comment: When checked, the flying block will move faster.

list.title: Behavior
list.entry: Moves further upright then grows wings

sprite.name: Roulette Block
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x06D Description: A block that cycles through different items. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

checkbox.title: Unknown Whomp-related Flag
checkbox.comment: This flag is on when spawned by a Whomp.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: This powerup will be in-between the Super Mushroom (first item) and 1-Up Mushroom (last item). 3 is unused.

value.title: [Broken] ID
value.comment: Broken; If set to any value greater than 0, the item in the roulette will disappear when hit.

sprite.name: POW Block
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0B2 Description: A block that will send a shockwave when something collides with it. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: N/A

checkbox.title: Automatically Triggered
checkbox.comment: When checked, the powblock will act as if it has been hit upon being loaded. [Unused]

sprite.name: Movement-controlled POW Block
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0B3 Description: A movement controlled POW block. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have a movement ID set.

checkbox.title: Automatically Triggered
checkbox.comment: When checked, the powblock will act as if it has been hit upon being loaded.

sprite.name: Bob-omb

list.title: Pipe-spawned Direction
list.comment: Is used if Behavior is set to 1. Values > 3 loops.

value.title: Z-Order Modifier
value.comment: This field is used by the Enemy Generator for Pipe and increases by 1 each time a new enemy is spawned.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 9
checkbox.comment: Set to 1 if the Enemy Generator for Pipe's Unknown 8 setting value is odd.

list.title: Cannon Shot Direction
list.comment: Used internally by the Parabomb Cannon (215). Values 2 and 3 are used when the Rotation of the Cannon is set to 1. Values 4 and 5 don't seem to be accessible when using the Cannon.

checkbox.title: Ignore Tile Behaviors
checkbox.comment: Slopes and semisolids will be seen as full solid by the enemy.

sprite.notes: Actor: 0x149 Description: An enemy that moves along tracks. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must be placed on a track.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Spawned when this event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Duplicate)
value.comment: Takes priority over the other ID if set.

checkbox.title: Big
checkbox.comment: Makes the fuzzy bigger.

checkbox.title: Move Left/Down
checkbox.comment: Makes the fuzzy move leftward or downward.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Won't despawn off-screen if the location is on-screen.

sprite.name: Checkpoint Flag
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x18A Description: A Checkpoint, When hit the player will respawn at the specified entrance. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have an entrance ID set.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The entrance the player will respawn at.

list.title: Coinrush Timer Value
list.comment: Ammount of time to add to the timer upon touching the flag.

list.title: Checkpoint Number
list.comment: Determines the checkpoint number.

sprite.name: Rotation Controller - Swaying
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x020 Description: A Controller that makes sprites sway from side to side. Event Triggerable: No Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have a Rotation ID and a Swing Arc set.

list.title: Initial Behavior
list.comment: If set to Event Triggered, it cannot be deactivated afterwards.

list.title: Pre-Rotation
list.comment: Calculated as (Swing Arc / 2 * cos(value)). On level load, sprites will jump to a position as if they had already rotated this many degrees, then they will start rotating. Direction is inverted when Initial Movement is set to Clockwise.

list.title: Arc Middle Rotation
list.comment: Determines the center position of the swing.

value.title: Delay
value.comment: Delay between swaying clockwise and counterclockwise. 0 is no delay. Higher values take longer.

value.title: Speed of Rotation
value.comment: 0 doesn't sway. Higher values are faster.

sprite.name: Rotation Controller - Spinning
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x01E Description: A Controller that makes sprites rotate around a point. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have a Rotation ID and a Swing Arc set.

list.title: Starting Rotation Offset
list.comment: Sets the intital rotation for this controller. Some sprites will ignore this if the event mode is set to 1 or 2, unless a setting is enabled in the sprite. This value is doubled for coins and bricks if event mode is set to event triggered.

list.title: Rotation Distance
list.comment: Determines how far this controller will rotate.

list.title: Event Mode
list.comment: This changes how events interact with this rotation controller.
list.entry: Event Triggered - Rotates Back When Deactivated (Fastest)
Event Triggered - Rotates Back When Deactivated (Slow)
Event Triggered - Rotates Back When Deactivated (Slowest)

checkbox.title: Coin Sound
checkbox.comment: This effect requires coins, star/moon coins or brick/hard/questionmark blocks to be paired to the controller.

checkbox.title: Screen Shake For Direction Change
checkbox.comment: This effect requires event mode to be set to 4 or 8. This effect is activated only when the rotation is interrupted.

checkbox.title: Hidden

list.title: Spawn Behavior
list.comment: Changes how the coin spawns. Is probably used internally when spawning coins. [Unused]

checkbox.title: Temporary Coin
checkbox.comment: Causes the coin to despawn after a couple of seconds, similar to a coin dropped by an enemy. [unused]

list.title: Z-Order
list.comment: Determines the Z position of the coin. Values > 2 are the same as 2.

sprite.name: Coin in Bubble

value.title: Triggering Event ID

list.title: Behavior
list.comment: determines how the coin will act. All other values are the same as 1. [Unused]

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Determines the movement type. Inital direction is determined based on the player's X position relative to the bubble.

checkbox.title: Spawn 3 Bubbles
checkbox.comment: If set to 1 and only to 1, the bubble will spawn 2 additional bubbles nearby, and each bubbles will exhibit different movement.

sprite.name: Coin Spawner - Eruption

value.title: Triggering Event ID

checkbox.comment: Allows the coin spawner to be reactivated. The triggering event ID will be disabled when the timer runs out.

checkbox.title: Coins Go Through Tiles
checkbox.comment: When checked coins will pass through tiles.

value.title: Time Active
value.comment: 0 is the same as 3. Higher values last longer.

checkbox.title: Blue Coins

list.title: Eruption Spread
list.comment: Determines how high and how wide the eruption is.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Determines the direction to spawn the coins. Values > 3 repeat.

list.title: Effect
list.comment: The effect to be played when spawning coins.

value.title: Start Active
value.comment: If checked, the coin spawner will be triggered as soon as it is on screen.

checkbox.title: Reactivateable

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The Direction the coins will move in.

value.title: Number Of Coins

checkbox.title: Blue Coins
checkbox.comment: Spawns blue coins.

value.title: Arc Height

value.title: Arc Width
value.comment: Determines how wide the arc will be.

list.title: Rotation Mode
list.comment: The behavior of this rotating coin.

checkbox.title: Use Rotation Controller Starting Rotation Offset
checkbox.comment: If enabled, the Coin Will use the start offset specified in the rotation controller.

checkbox.title: Temporary Coin
checkbox.comment: Causes the coin to despawn after a couple of seconds, similar to a coin dropped by an enemy. Is also offset up and to the left. [unused]

list.comment: Determines the Z position of the coin. Values > 2 are the same as 2.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Used to pair the coin to a movement controller.

sprite.name: Red Coin
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x0D6 Description: A Red Coin that is appears when a red coin ring triggers it. Event Triggerable: Yes Affected by Gold Ring: No Requirements: Must have A triggering ID set.

checkbox.title: Use Rotation Controller Starting Rotation Offset
checkbox.comment: If enabled, the red coin will use the start offset specified in the rotation controller.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: What triggers the coin activating.

list.title: Coin Type
list.comment: 0 makes the coin normal, or makes it fall in a straight line. 1 and 2 make the coin into a paracoin, and both are at a different sync.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: The type of movement exhibited by this red coin. When set to falling, the coin ignores collisions (to be used for paracoins). Value 13 (gravity affected) is used internally by the Coin Coffer.

value.title: Red Coin ID
value.comment: This field is used to differentiate Red Coins when multiple Red Coin Rings are present For example, if a Red Coin with a different ID is picked up, it will not count towards the same chain as the previous one, and will use the one associated with its ID.

checkbox.title: Rotation-controlled
checkbox.comment: Allows the red coin to be paired to a rotation controller, like the standard rotation-controlled coin. Does not support all functionality that the dedicated rotation-controlled variant does.

sprite.name: Rotation-controlled Red Coin

list.title: Rotation Mode
list.comment: The behavior of this rotating red coin.

checkbox.title: Use Rotation Controller Starting Rotation Offset
checkbox.comment: If enabled, the red coin will use the start offset specified in the rotation controller.

list.title: Coin Type (Broken)
list.comment: Carried over from the normal Red Coin. If set to a Paracoin the parachute will not be attached to the coin and will stay in place (even if the coin is stationary). NOTE: Game will crash when attempting to render the parachute model if no normal Red Coins are present.

list.title: Movement Type (Broken)
list.comment: Carried over from the normal Red Coin. This setting will only work if the coin is not paired with a rotation controller.

value.title: Red Coin ID
value.comment: This field is used to differentiate Red Coins when multiple Red Coin Rings are present For example, if a Red Coin with a different ID is picked up, it will not count towards the same chain as the previous one, and will use the one associated with its ID.

value.comment: Increases the distance the fish bone swims before changing direction.

sprite.notes: Triggers a target Event ID after the triggering Event ID was modified per the activation mode. (If X, do Y)

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The delay between the trigger. One delay unit = 10 frames.

list.title: Delay Mode
list.comment: Determines how the controller should act when a delay is set. Requires a delay value greater than 0 to be set. Behavior is inverted if Event Mode is set to 1.

list.title: Activation Mode
list.comment: When set to 1 the Target Event is only triggered if the Triggering Event has been disabled.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: When set to 1 the events will activate only while the triggering event is still active.
list.entry: Only While Start Event Is Active

list.title: Event Mode
list.comment: When set to 1 the controller will disable the target event.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The flag that will activate when the player/enemy is in the location.

list.comment: Settings 1 and 2 are mutually exclusive for the movement requirement; both players being in the same location will deactivate it.

value.title: Player Watch Location ID
value.comment: The player has to be in this location. If this needs to be ignored, check the designated checkbox.

checkbox.title: Ignore Player Location
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will ignore the player's location.

value.title: Enemy Watch Location ID
value.comment: The enemy has to be in this location. If this needs to be ignored, check the designated checkbox.

checkbox.title: Ignore Enemy Location

list.title: Required Player Form

list.comment: Determines whether the controller enables or disables the event.

value.title: Delay

list.title: Event Mode
list.comment: Determines whether the controller enables or disables the event.

value.title: Start Event ID (Triggering)

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The delay between triggers. One delay unit = 10 frames.

list.title: Usage Mode

list.entry: Only While Start Event Is Active

list.title: Event Mode
list.comment: Determines whether the controller enables or disables the event.

list.title: Event Mode
list.comment: Determines whether the controller enables or disables the event.

list.comment: Determines the direction of the cheep cheep.

checkbox.title: Huge Cheep Cheep

list.title: Swim Speed

checkbox.comment: If enabled, the Brick Block Will use the start offset specified in the rotation controller.

checkbox.comment: Makes the switch upside down.

sprite.name: Invisible Ceiling
sprite.notes:
An invisible ceiling that the player can not pass through; other sprites can pass through this barrier freely.
If at any point the player is above the barrier, they will be teleported back below it.

checkbox.comment: If checked the sound of Mario bonking his head will be played when hitting the Invisible Ceiling, like regular blocks.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Sets the width of the invisible ceiling.

checkbox.title: Is Ground-poundable
checkbox.comment: It will allow the head part to be ground-pounded.

list.title: Height Position on Ending
list.comment: Used to determine the height (relative to ending Path Node) the platform will remain at when it reaches the end of his path. If Sway Sync is 1, it will be higher up. If Sway Sync is 2, it will be lower down.

value.title: Movement ID

list.comment: Needs further testing.
list.entry: Unload if far from start of zone

value.title: Tiles to Move (When triggered)
value.comment: The distance the lift moves when event triggered.

value.title: Tiles to Move
value.comment: The distance the lift moves.

list.title: Movement Speed
list.comment: The speed the lift moves at. Values greater then 4 make the lift not move at all. 4 can be glitchy in certain circumstances.

list.title: Height
list.comment: Values greater than 2 cause the game to crash.

sprite.name: Staff Credits - Koopa Clown Car
sprite.notes: The Koopa Clown Car actor used for the staff credits.

sprite.name: Path-controlled Lift
sprite.notes: Uses the Path Node "Variable Use" field to determine how rotation acts, a value of 0 will cause the platform to wobble, a value of 1 will cause the platform to be at a fixed rotation.

value.title: Starting Path Node
value.comment: The ID of the path node the platform will start at.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: The ID of the path the platform will follow.

value.title: Platform Length
value.comment: Length of the platform.

list.title: Start Behavior
list.comment: Determines Starting Behaviour.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Sets the direction of movement. If set to backwards while starting at node 0, the platform will spin in a circle. [Unused]

list.title: End Behavior
list.comment: The behavior of the platform after it hits the last node.

checkbox.title: Smooth Direction Changes
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will smooth out all all direction changes instead of snapping sharply.

sprite.name: Mushroom Platform - Snow
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x02f

value.title: Stretch Length
value.comment: Value is used differently depending on selected stretch mode.

list.title: Tilt Angle
list.comment: Determines the angle the mushroom will tilt to.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: Determines the initial direction the mushroom will tilt.

value.title: Stem Length
value.comment: Value + 4

value.title: Mushroom Length
value.comment: Value + 3.

value.title: Tilt Speed
value.comment: Value Modulo 64. Speed increases for values 1-32, then decreases for values 33-63.

sprite.name: Big Grinder
sprite.notes: A big saw-like object that runs on rails that moves at certain speeds and directions.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Spawned when this event is activated.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Won't despawn off-screen if the location is on-screen.

sprite.name: Ending Birds
sprite.notes: Birds that are used for the ending.

sprite.name: Invisible Tile Collider
sprite.notes:
An invisible tile collider.
This only exists so that you can't grab the bottom of the flagpole in 2-A.

checkbox.title: Head Bonk Sound
checkbox.comment: If checked the sound of Mario bonking his head will be played when hitting the Invisible Tile Collider, like regular blocks.

sprite.name: Disabler - Super Mushroom Bubble
sprite.notes: Disables the Super Mushroom Bubble.
